projectDesc.p: To the tune “Treading on the Sedges”—"On The Narrow Path" is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “Treading on the Sedges"
On the narrow path, red flowers are few now,
While the fragrant countryside is green throughout.
The color of the trees upon the high terrace appears dark and shady.
The spring breeze does not know to prevent the willow catkins
from pelting the faces of passersby in a drizzle of fluff.
The verdant leaves hide the orioles;

The pearl curtain
Refers to a curtain made of strung pearls.
keeps the swallows
Swallows here refers to the girls behind the curtain.
out.
The incense burner quietly chases the winding smoke.
After a sorrowful dream, as I sober up,
The slanting sun shines into the deep courtyard.
